intro: Waltheria pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered waltheria, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Waltheria pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
